Mobile grocery delivery: Supermarkets could transform into mobile businesses, delivering food and groceries directly to customers' doors, minimizing waste and environmental impact.
Indoor vertical farming: Supermarkets could shift focus to becoming large-scale indoor vertical farms, providing organic, pesticide-free, locally-sourced produce.
Local food cooperatives: Shoppers could join local food cooperatives that source food from smaller, local suppliers, enabling them to stock up on fresh items directly from farmers.
Farm-to-door subscriptions: Farmers could offer subscriptions service, delivering freshly harvested produce directly to individual households, bypassing the supermarket system entirely.

Urban farming initiatives: Supermarkets could be transformed into community gardens. By repurposing existing spaces, this enables fresh produce to be harvested and served in the vicinity while promoting sustainable agriculture and urban development.
